title: Change in Slope
alt: Squinting at a graph is fine for getting a rough idea of the answer, but if you want to pretend to know it exactly, you need statistics.
transcript:
How to detect a change in the slope of your data[First column, on the left]
Novice method:
[A graph, with dots forming a rough line, math formulas, and sub graphs]
Do a bunch of statistics[Second column, on the right]
Expert method:
[Perspective view of the previous graph, with the legend "Hey look, it bends here" and an arrow pointing to the graph]
Tip the graph sideways
